There's actually plenty of leaked objects in the log besides those above. I suspect the shutdown procedure goes wrong.

The rootcause seems to be 
```
iomgr.cc:127]              
D0226 09:16:29.661178186   23298 iomgr.cc:127]               Failed to free 1 iomgr objects before shutdown deadline: memory leaks are likely
D0226 09:16:29.661258471   23298 iomgr.cc:75]                LEAKED OBJECT: tcp-server-connection:ipv4:127.0.0.1:39374 fd=9 0x61100004ffa8
```

I am trying to get a refcount sample. But this test has another more frequent failure (#14703).
Got a sample. I will compare that to a normal run.

The [log](https://gist.github.com/AspirinSJL/412f5b700248b69388c73dc34689145c) shows that FD 13 is added to 2 pollsets. but one of these never calls [`finish_shutdown(grpc_pollset* pollset)`](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/iomgr/ev_poll_posix.cc#L854). There are four callers of this functions. @sreecha Any suggestions about how to dig deeper?
We will talk about this offline today.

@sreecha also has taken a look. But it still needs more investigation. 

At this moment, my only idea is to log the stacktrace of each `finish_shutdown(grpc_pollset* pollset)` invocation to see which invocation we are missing for the leaked FD. Trying.

I'm OOO this week, and will come back to work next Monday. 

If we are planning to fix all the P1 build issues during fixit, I don't feel confident that I can achieve it on time. So I'm re-assigning it to @sreecha since this seems to be a pollset issue. Please maybe pass it back to @ncteisen if you have too many P1 build issues on your plate...

Regarding the issue itself, I was thinking about printing out the stacktrace of `finish_shutdown()`. But I haven't found a way to do so. We have some internal logging utility to log the full stacktrace at a line of code. But we will need a dependency on that internal util library. We need to figure out how to build the test.
